title: TOTALS BY ASSEMBLY DISTRICT IN CITYWIDE ELECTIONS; MAYOR

body: Mayor Koch, carrying Democratic and Republican endorsements, won a second term in a landslide yesterday as Democrats swept citywide and boroughwide offices. The 56-year-old Mayor and his two Democratic running mates, City Council President Carol Bellamy and Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin, overwhelmed their opponents with at least 75 percent of the
title: FLORIO AND KEAN IN TIGHT RACE; KOCH RE-ELECTED IN LANDSLIDE; ROBB IS THE WINNER IN VIRGINIA

body: Frank Tieri, who Federal authorities said was the first person ever convicted of heading an organized-crime family, died at Mount Sinai Hospital Sunday after a long illness. He was 77 years old. Mr. Tieri, who entered Mount Sinai on March 15, died at 1:35 P.M., according to Mrs. S. McFarland, the nursing administrator. She declined to say what the
title: FRANK TIERI, 77, CONVICTED NEW YORK CRIME LEADER

body: Frank Tieri, who Federal authorities said was the first person ever convicted of heading an organized-crime family, died at Mount Sinai hospital yesterday after a long illness.He was 77 years old. Mr. Tieri, who entered Mount Sinai on March 15, died at 1:35 P.M., according to Mrs. S. McFarland, the nursing administrator. She declined to say what
title: FRANK TIERI, THE FIRST CONVICTED OF HEADING A CRIME FAMILY, DIES
